title: function pointers as match patterns have optimization-dependent behavior

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-patterns
labels.description: Relating to patterns and pattern matching

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code, supplied by @eddyb [play](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=a1a4aafc915c188318a377d0a20e36d3):
 
```rust
#![feature(test)]
use std::hint::black_box;

fn foo() {}
const FOO: fn() = foo;

fn bar() {}
const BAR: fn() = bar;

#[inline(never)]
fn print(s: &str) {
    println!("{}", s);
}

fn main() {
    match black_box(FOO) {
        FOO => print("FOO"),
        BAR => print("BAR"),
        _ => unreachable!(),
    }
    
    match black_box(FOO) {
        BAR => print("BAR"),
        FOO => print("FOO"),
        _ => unreachable!(),
    }
    
    match black_box(BAR) {
        FOO => print("FOO"),
        BAR => print("BAR"),
        _ => unreachable!(),
    }
    
    match black_box(BAR) {
        BAR => print("BAR"),
        FOO => print("FOO"),
        _ => unreachable!(),
    }
}
```

I expected to see this happen: print out of
```
FOO
FOO
BAR
BAR
```
(and in debug builds, that *is* what happens).


Instead, this happened: in release builds, it prints:

```
FOO
BAR
FOO
BAR
```


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

This was on a playpen running 1.44.0-nightly, 2020-04-05.

This all arose from a conversation with @eddyb regarding structural match; you can read it on the [zulip archive](https://zulip-archive.rust-lang.org/131828tcompiler/22816Structuralmatchmarkertraits.html#193034951)

cc #31434
